summary: CurrencyPal: a live global currency exchange rates website with 2–3 currency comparison, now planning custom domain setup and potential Google AdSense monetization.
architectural_notes: Planned custom domain to register/use: GetCurrencyPal.com (via external registrar) and connect to live deployment.
User confirmed to proceed with adding Google AdSense code/integration to the site.
AdSense visible placement should be positioned above the main content (top-of-content placement), per user preference.
User provided AdSense script tag with publisher/client ID ca-pub-5965886176480370 and requested it be placed in the <head> on all pages (site-wide head include).

existing_features.title: Create a home page that shows live global currency exchange rates in a searchable/sortable table, with a user-selectable base currency (default to USD). Display: currency code, currency name (if available), and the current rate relative to the selected base.

Add a comparison feature that lets users pick either 2 or 3 currencies to compare side-by-side, including: (1) each selected currency’s rate relative to the chosen base currency, and (2) a simple conversion widget where the user enters an amount and sees converted amounts for the other selected currencies.

Implement live rate fetching with automatic refresh using React Query. Use a public exchange-rate REST API endpoint that does not require third-party authentication for basic usage (or provide a single configurable endpoint constant so the data source can be swapped later).

Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme and apply it consistently across the app (layout, typography, spacing, components). Avoid a blue/purple primary palette; use a different primary color direction suitable for a finance/data dashboard.
Add historical exchange-rate charting for a selected currency relative to the currently selected base currency, using the existing Frankfurter API base URL constant (https://api.frankfurter.app).
Implement a date-range control for historical charts with at least these presets: 7D, 1M, 3M, 1Y, and ensure the chart updates when the range changes.

Add a dedicated historical-rates data fetcher and React Query hook (separate from live rates) that caches results by (baseCurrency, targetCurrency, dateRange) and supports manual refresh within the historical view.
Expose an entry point to open historical charts from the existing rates UI (the searchable/sortable rates table), without removing or breaking existing table sorting/search behavior.

Add Google AdSense support to the React site by loading the AdSense script in the app HTML entrypoint using a configurable AdSense publisher/client ID (e.g., ca-pub-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX), and ensure the script is not duplicated across navigations/renders.

Create a reusable Ad unit component that renders an AdSense ad slot using configurable values (ad slot ID, format/responsive settings), and safely initializes (pushes) ads only on the client after the script has loaded.

Add at least one visible AdSense placement to the CurrencyPal UI (e.g., a responsive banner in the main content area or footer) without breaking existing layouts and interactions (rates table search/sort, historical open/close, comparison panel).
Add a small, user-friendly fallback state for ad slots (e.g., reserved space or a subtle placeholder) when ads are blocked/unavailable or configuration is missing, so the page layout remains stable.

Fix the Google AdSense script loader in frontend/index.html to use the Vite-supported environment variable interpolation mechanism (instead of the literal '__VITE_ADSENSE_CLIENT_ID__' placeholder), so that setting VITE_ADSENSE_CLIENT_ID actually results in the AdSense script being loaded at runtime, and ensure the script is not duplicated if already present.

Make the visible ad placement configurable without code changes by moving the HomePage banner ad slot ID out of the hard-coded value ('1234567890') and into a frontend environment variable, and update frontend/.env.example accordingly. If the ad slot variable is missing/empty, render the existing AdSense fallback UI so layout remains stable.

Add two additional, clearly-defined AdSense placement locations on the Home page: (1) a "Top banner" ad positioned directly under the sticky header and above the main controls; and (2) a "Footer banner" ad positioned directly above the footer. Each placement must render via the existing reusable <AdSenseAd /> component and must not break existing layout or interactions (rates table search/sort, historical open/close, comparison panel).

Make the new Top banner and Footer banner ad slot IDs configurable via new Vite environment variables, and update frontend/.env.example accordingly. If a slot env var is missing/empty, the corresponding placement must render the existing AdSense fallback UI (reserved space/placeholder) so page layout remains stable.

Ensure AdSense initialization remains safe with multiple ad units on the same page: each new placement must only attempt to push ads on the client after the AdSense script is available, and must not cause console errors or repeated pushes that break rendering when navigating or re-rendering HomePage.

Update the HomePage layout so the AdSense block is positioned above the main content (directly under the sticky header and above the controls/content), matching the user’s selection of "Above" for ad placement.

Ensure HomePage renders only the single above-content AdSense block (and does not render additional AdSense placements elsewhere on the Home page) to align with the single placement choice requested by the user.

Ensure the Google AdSense script with client ID `ca-pub-5965886176480370` is present in the document <head> for the CurrencyPal website (i.e., loaded on the initial page load and therefore applicable to all SPA routes/pages), matching the user-provided snippet, and without creating duplicate script tags.

Set the frontend configuration so that `VITE_ADSENSE_CLIENT_ID` is configured to `ca-pub-5965886176480370` by default for developers (update `frontend/.env.example` accordingly), while keeping AdSense loading logic compatible with the existing environment-variable-based setup.

Allow users to compare 2 or 3 currencies side-by-side
Add historical exchange-rate charts for each currency
Integrate Google AdSense (ads) into the CurrencyPal website
